description: Assesses student's ability to write a story middle with events and a problem

levels.4: Events flow logically with clear order; transition words guide the reader smoothly
levels.3: Events are in logical order; some transition words used
levels.2: Events are present but order is sometimes confusing; few transitions
levels.1: Events are jumbled or hard to follow; no transitions

feedback_stems.strength: Your events flowed smoothly, especially when
feedback_stems.growth: Try using words like 'first,' 'then,' 'next,' and 'finally' to help readers follow along

levels.4: Clear, interesting problem that makes readers wonder how it will be solved
levels.2: There might be a problem but it's not clear or not very interesting
levels.1: No problem or challenge for the character

feedback_stems.strength: Your character's problem is interesting because
feedback_stems.growth: Stories are more exciting when the character has a bigger challenge to face

levels.4: Multiple events that connect to the problem and keep the story moving
levels.3: At least two events that relate to the story
levels.2: Only one event, or events don't seem connected
levels.1: No clear events; story doesn't move forward

feedback_stems.growth: Add more things that happen to your character as they deal with the problem
